action.action-desc: Mr. Posey introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on House Administration

form.official-title: To prohibit the payment of death gratuities to the surviving heirs of deceased Members of Congress.

section.header: Prohibiting payment of gratuities to survivors of Members of Congress

subsection.text: No payment may be made from the applicable accounts of the House of Representatives, the contingent fund of the Senate, or any other appropriated funds for a death gratuity payment to the widow, widower, or heirs-at-law of any Member of Congress who dies after the commencement of the Congress to which the Member has been elected.

subsection.header: No effect on other payments to survivors
subsection.text: Nothing in subsection (a) shall be construed to prohibit or affect the payment to any individual of any unpaid balance or salary or other sums due to a Member of Congress who dies after the commencement of the Congress to which the Member has been elected.

section.text: For purposes of this Act, a Member of Congress means a Senator or a Representative in, or Delegate or Resident Commissioner to, the Congress.
